ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] unsubscribe
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, you have to unsubscribe yourself. You can t expect others to do it for you. You did sign yourself up, you know, so you are all certainly able to handle
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, you have to unsubscribe yourself. You can't expect others to do it
for you. You did sign yourself up, you know, so you are all certainly able
to handle unsubscribing.

I got a beta invite on DaoC, but haven't yet DL'ed it to try it. I will
certainly be playing. I was a Female Gnome Warrior on Quellious, and plan to
play a Lurikeen Champion in DaoC.

Argynt


>From: "Osmosis" <osmosis@...>
>Reply-To: EQ_Tinkering@yahoogroups.com
>To: <EQ_Tinkering@yahoogroups.com>
>Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] unsubscribe
>Date: Tue, 2 Oct 2001 18:11:30 -0700
>
>If you want to unsubscribe to this group, try the email
>EQ_Tinkering-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
>
>typing Unsubscribe in the subject and emailing to the group will not
>unsubscribe you, it just annoys the rest of us.
>
>Whos playing Dark Age of Camelot? I'm in the beta, and this is definately
>going to be played by me, for great justice!
>
>-Cogg-
